text: Introduction
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Few of the more astute critics who have appraised the work of James
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Branch Cabell have failed to call attention to that extraordinary
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: cohesion which makes his very latest novel a further flowering of the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: seed of his very earliest literary work. Especially among his later
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: books does the scheme of each seem to dovetail into the scheme of the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: other and the whole of his writing take on the character of an
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: uninterrupted discourse. To this phenomenon, which is at once a fact and
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: an illusion of continuity, Mr. Cabell himself has consciously
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: contributed, not only by a subtly elaborate use of conjunctions, by
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: repetition, and by reintroducing characters from his other books, but by
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: actually setting his expertness in genealogy to the genial task of
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: devising a family tree for his figures of fiction.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: If this were an actual continuity, more tangible than that fluid
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: abstraction we call the life force; if it were merely a tireless
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: reiteration and recasting of characters, Mr. Cabell's work would have an
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: unbearable monotony. But at bottom this apparent continuity has no more
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: material existence than has the thread of lineal descent. To insist
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: upon its importance is to obscure, as has been obscured, the epic range
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: of Mr. Cabell's creative genius. It is to fail to observe that he has
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: treated in his many books every mainspring of human action and that his
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: themes have been the cardinal dreams and impulses which have in them
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: heroic qualities. Each separate volume has a unity and harmony of a
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: complete and separate life, for the excellent reason that with the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: consummate skill of an artist he is concerned exclusively in each book
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: with one definite heroic impulse and its frustrations.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: It is true, of course, that like the fruit of the tree of life, Mr.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Cabell's artistic progeny sprang from a first conceptual germ--"In the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: beginning was the Word." That animating idea is the assumption that if
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: life may be said to have an aim it must be an aim to terminate in
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: success and splendor. It postulates the high, fine importance of excess,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: the choice or discovery of an overwhelming impulse in life and a
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: conscientious dedication to its fullest realization. It is the quality
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: and intensity of the dream only which raises men above the biological
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: norm; and it is fidelity to the dream which differentiates the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: exceptional figure, the man of heroic stature, from the muddling,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: aimless mediocrities about him. What the dream is, matters not at
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: all--it may be a dream of sainthood, kingship, love, art, asceticism or
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: sensual pleasure--so long as it is fully expressed with all the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: resources of self. It is this sort of completion which Mr. Cabell has
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: elected to depict in all his work: the complete sensualist in
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Demetrios, the complete phrase-maker in Felix Kennaston, the complete
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: poet in Marlowe, the complete lover in Perion. In each he has shown that
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: this complete self-expression is achieved at the expense of all other
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: possible selves, and that herein lies the tragedy of the ideal.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Perfection is a costly flower and is cultured only by an uncompromising,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: strict husbandry.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: All this is, we see, the ideational gonfalon under which surge the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: romanticists; but from the evidence at hand it is the banner to which
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: life also bears allegiance. It is in humanity's records that it has
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: reserved its honors for its romantic figures. It remembers its Caesars,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: its saints, its sinners. It applauds, with a complete suspension of
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: moral judgment, its heroines and its heroes who achieve the greatest
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: self-realization. And from the splendid triumphs and tragic defeats of
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: humanity's individual strivings have come our heritage of wisdom and of
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: poetry.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Once we understand the fundamentals of Mr. Cabell's artistic aims, it is
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: not easy to escape the fact that in _Figures of Earth_ he undertook the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: staggering and almost unsuspected task of rewriting humanity's sacred
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: books, just as in _Jurgen_ he gave us a stupendous analogue of the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: ceaseless quest for beauty. For we must accept the truth that Mr. Cabell
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: is not a novelist at all in the common acceptance of the term, but a
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: historian of the human soul. His books are neither documentary nor
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: representational; his characters are symbols of human desires and
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: motives. By the not at all simple process of recording faithfully the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: projections of his rich and varied imagination, he has written thirteen
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: books, which he accurately terms biography, wherein is the bitter-sweet
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: truth about human life.

text: II
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Among the scant certainties vouchsafed us is that every age lives by its
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: special catchwords. Whether from rebellion against the irking monotony
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: of its inherited creeds or from compulsions generated by its own
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: complexities, each age develops its code of convenient illusions which
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: minimize cerebration in dilemmas of conduct by postulating an
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: unequivocal cleavage between the current right and the current wrong. It
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: works until men tire of it or challenge the cleavage, or until
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: conditions render the code obsolete. It has in it, happily, a certain
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: poetic merit always; it presents an ideal to be lived up to; it gives
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: direction to the uncertain, stray impulses of life.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: The Chivalric code is no worse than most and certainly it is prettier
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: than some. It is a code peculiar to an age, or at least it flourishes
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: best in an age wherein sentiment and the stuff of dreams are easily
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: translatable into action. Its requirements are less of the intellect
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: than of the heart. It puts God, honor, and mistress above all else, and
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: stipulates that a knight shall serve these three without any
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: reservation. It requires of its secular practitioners the holy virtues
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: of an active piety, a modified chastity, and an unqualified obedience,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: at all events, to the categorical imperative. The obligation of poverty
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: it omits, for the code arose at a time when the spiritual snobbery of
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: the meek and lowly was not pressing the simile about the camel and the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: eye of the needle. It leads to charming manners and to delicate
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: amenities. It is the opposite of the code of Gallantry, for while the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: code of Chivalry takes everything with a becoming seriousness, the code
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: of Gallantry takes everything with a wink. If one should stoop to pick
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: flaws with the Chivalric ideal, it would be to point out a certain
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: priggishness and intolerance. For, while it is all very well for one to
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: cherish the delusion that he is God's vicar on earth and to go about his
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Father's business armed with a shining rectitude, yet the unhallowed may
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

text: In the year of grace 1326, upon Walburga's Eve, some three hours after
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: sunset (thus Nicolas begins), had you visited a certain garden on the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: handsome boy, prone on the turf, where by turns he groaned and vented
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: himself in sullen curses. His profanity had its palliation. Heir to
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: England though he was, you must know that this boy's father in the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: flesh had hounded him from England, as more recently had the lad's
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

text: emperor.

text: Accordingly the boy aspersed his destiny. At hand a nightingale
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: carolled as though an exiled prince were the blithest spectacle the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: moon knew.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: There came through the garden a tall girl, running, stumbling in her
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: haste. "Hail, King of England!" she said.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: "Do not mock me, Philippa!" the boy half-sobbed. Sulkily he rose to
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: his feet.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: "No mockery here, my fair sweet friend. No, I have told my father all
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: which happened yesterday. I pleaded for you. He questioned me very
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: closely. And when I had ended, he stroked his beard, and presently
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: struck one hand upon the table. 'Out of the mouth of babes!' he said.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Then he said: 'My dear, I believe for certain that this lady and her
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: son have been driven from their kingdom wrongfully. If it be for the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: royal lineage, and to whose blood we ourselves are related!' And
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: accordingly he and your mother have their heads together yonder,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: planning an invasion of England, no less, and the dethronement of your
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: wicked father, my Edward. And accordingly--hail, King of England!" The
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

text: In the year of grace 1399 (Nicolas begins) dwelt in a hut near Caer
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Dathyl in Arvon, as he had dwelt for some five years, a gaunt hermit,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: notoriously consecrate, whom neighboring Welshmen revered as the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Blessed Evrawc. There had been a time when people called him Edward
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Maudelain, but this period he dared not often remember.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: For though in macerations of the flesh, in fasting, and in hour-long
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: prayers he spent his days, this holy man was much troubled by devils.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: He got little rest because of them. Sometimes would come into his hut
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Belphegor in the likeness of a butler, and whisper, "Sire, had you
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: been King, as was your right, you had drunk to-day not water but the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: King, as was your right, you had lain now not upon the bare earth but
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: on cushions of silk."
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: One day in early spring, they say, the spirit called Orvendile sent
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: the likeness of a fair woman with yellow hair and large blue eyes. She
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: wore a massive crown which seemed too heavy for her frailness to
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: sustain. Soft tranquil eyes had lifted from her book. "You are my
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: cousin now, messire," this phantom had appeared to say.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: That was the worst, and Maudelain began to fear he was a little mad
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: because even this he had resisted with many aves.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: afternoon of All Soul's day, a horseman in a long cloak of black. He
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: tethered his black horse and he came noiselessly through the doorway
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: of the hut, and upon his breast and shoulders the snow was white as
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: the bleached bones of those women that died in Merlin's youth.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: "Greetings in God's name, Messire Edward Maudelain," the stranger
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: said.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Since the new-comer spoke intrepidly of holy things a cheerier
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: Maudelain knew that this at least was no demon. "Greetings!" he
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: answered. "But I am Evrawc. You name a man long dead."
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: the dead receive me?" And thus speaking, the stranger dropped his
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: cloak.
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: He was clad, as you now saw, in flame-colored satin, which shimmered
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: with each movement like a high flame. He had the appearance of a tall,
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: lean youngster, with crisp, curling, very dark red hair. He now
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: regarded Maudelain. He displayed peculiarly wide-set brown eyes; and
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: their gaze was tender, and the tears somehow had come to Maudelain's
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

text: eyes because of his great love for this tall stranger. "Eh, from the
title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
author: Cabell, James Branch

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines

title: Chivalry: Dizain des Reines
